remarks: Two ways to express single-valuedness of a class expression ` C ( y ) ` .  See ~ reusv1 for the connection to uniqueness. (Contributed by NM, 27-Dec-2012.)
statement:
reusv3.1 $e |- ( y = z -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
reusv3.2 $e |- ( y = z -> C = D ) $.
reusv3 $p |- ( E. y e. B ( ph /\ C e. A ) -> ( A. y e. B A. z e. B ( ( ph /\ ps ) -> C = D ) <-> E. x e. A A. y e. B ( ph -> x = C ) ) ) $.
$d A x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d C x z $.
$d D x y $.
$d ph x z $.
$d ps x y $.
